cont.entity_a: Marvel chipset bug causes Wi-Fi network crashes with patched Android devices.
cont.entity_b: Signal strength reduces with walls between laptop and router.

cont.entity_a: Router stops broadcasting on 2.4 GHz and requires frequent reboots.
Firmware modification allows VPN setup, providing an encrypted path. Open source firmware support enhances customization options.
Router handles heavy traffic well, with easy web-interface navigation.
Wi-Fi coverage is excellent, but higher frequency band performance is poor.
Router requires frequent reboots after recent firmware update. Frequent Wi-Fi disconnections necessitate frequent reboots. Router performance degrades under load, causing random reboots.
cont.entity_b: Requires daily reboot for continued functionality.

cont.entity_a: Setup wizard is problematic; manual configuration recommended.
cont.entity_b: Setup is easy but shared mode has DNS passthrough issues. Easy to set up and use for creating a hotspot.

cont.entity_a: Router overheats due to lack of cooling fan.
Router lacks advanced customization with basic firmware. Router is DD-WRT compatible for enhanced control.
Customer service sent a replacement for a faulty unit.

cont.entity_b: Does not work with DSL modems.
Good for traveling, with a carry case and light weight.
WPA configuration is simple, but WEP is problematic.
Router stopped working after four months, out of warranty.
